Shanghai Ballet Troupe Performs for Guests of Honor
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Artistes 
    Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with the leading members and principal dancers of the Shanghai Ballet Troupe of China led by Li Baoshun, vice party committee secretary of the Shanghai Media and Entertainment Group, on a visit to the DPRK at the Mansudae Art Theatre on Sept. 14.
 Present there were Jo Myong Rok, Pak Pong Ju, Kim Il Chol and Jon Pyong Ho, and Chinese Ambassador to Korea Wu Donghe.

articles.content:
Greetings to Nicaraguan President
    Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Enrique Bolanos Geyer, president of Nicaragua, on the occasion of its independence day.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would develop on good terms in the interests of the two peoples, the message wished the president great success in his work for progress and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Mexico
articles.content:
Message of Condolence to Swedish Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of condolence to Swedish Prime Minister Goran Persson.
 Upon hearing the sad news of the unfortunate death of Swedish Foreign Minister Anna Lindh, he expressed deep condolences to the prime minister and, through him, to the Swedish government and the bereaved family of the deceased, the message said.

articles.title: Friendly Meeting with German Women
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Mexico
    Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of greetings to Vicente Fox Quesada, president of Mexico, on the occasion of its independence day.
 The message wished the president greater success in the work for the prosperity and economic development of the country and the wellbeing of the people and expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets German Women's Delegation
DPRK Weightlifters Prove Successful at Asian Championships
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets German Women's Delegation
    Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with the delegation of the National Council of German Women's Organizations led by its President Inge V. Bonninghausen at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Saying that they were deeply impressed to visit beautiful Korea, the head of the delegation hoped that the north and the south of Korea would be reunified independently by the concerted efforts of the nation.    
 Present there were Ri Yong Hui, vice-chairperson of the Central Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union, and Thomas Gerberich, charge d'affaires ad interim of the German embassy here.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
DPRK Weightlifters Prove Successful at Asian Championships
    Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- DPRK weightlifters proved successful at the 35th Asian Men's Weightlifting Championships and the 16th Asian Women's Weightlifting Championships held in Qinhuangdao, Hebei Province, China.
 More than 90 players from 16 countries and regions attended the championships. The DPRK players gave a good account of themselves in several categories by displaying their high technique and staunch fighting spirit.    
 Im Yong Su came second in total in men's 62 kg jerk and snatch events while Choe Un Sim second in women's 48 kg jerk and snatch events. Ri Kyong Sok came third in total in men's 56 kg category.

articles.title: DPRK Judoist Kye Sun Hui Bags Gold Medal
Reception Given by Vice-President of Uganda
articles.content:
DPRK Judoist Kye Sun Hui Bags Gold Medal
    Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- DPRK judoist Kye Sun Hui came first in the women's 57 kg category at the World Judo Championships held in Osaka, Japan.
 In the final she beat German player by ippon and became a champion.    
 She won gold medals in the women's 48 kg category at Atlanta Olympic Games in 1996 and in the 52 kg category at the World Judo Championships in 2001.

articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Libyan Head of State
    Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Moammer el Gaddafi, leader of the Great September First Revolution of the Great Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya, sent a floral basket to leader Kim Jong Il in congratulation of his reelection as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK at the First Session of the 11th Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.
 The floral basket was conveyed to an official concerned by Ahmed Amer Al Muakkaf, secretary of the People's Bureau of Libya to the DPRK, on September 12.

DPRK Government Cultural Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Ugandan Delegation Leaves
    Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The state delegation of Uganda led by Vice-President Bukenya Gilbert Balibaseka left for home today.
 It was seen off at the airport by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Vice-President of House of Lords of UK Arrives
articles.content:
DPRK Government Cultural Delegation Leaves
    Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government cultural delegation led by Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, left Pyongyang today to visit Mongolia, Laos and Iran.
 It was seen off at Pyongyang Railway Station by Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the committee, Iranian Ambassador to the DPRK Jalaleddin Namini Mianji, Mongolian Charge d' Affaires A.I. to the DPRK D. Sukh Ochir and Lao Charge d' Affaires A. I. to the DPRK Manith Sengsathith.
